name: APLX 116
title: Discourse Analysis: Language Use and Context
description: Familiarizes students with the methods and theoretical assumptions behind discourse analytic approaches to the study of language. Examines language used in specific contexts. Topics include: genres, registers; discourse organization; discourse grammar; interaction; conversation; pragmatics; and social practice.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): LING 50 or by consent of the instructor. Enrollment is restricted to juniors and seniors.
